Description: Glazed steatite commemorative scarab with the elytra marked and humeral callosities present, feathered legs, longitudinally pierced, the base inscribed with twelve rows of hieroglyphs commemorating the construction of a lake by Amenhotep III.
Bibliographic references: Blankenberg-Van Delden 1969 / The large commemorative scarabs of Amenhotep III (E2)
Monaco 2008 / Queens of Egypt: from Hetepheres to Cleopatra
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2008 Jul-Sep, Monaco, Grimaldi Forum, Reines de Egyptes 2015 July - September, Tokyo, National Museum, Queens of Egypt 2015 October - December, Osaka, National Museum of Art, Queens of Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Hugh Algernon Percy, 10th Duke of Northumberland
